quest.name: The Search for Lord Hien
journal: Yugiri has a simple plan for finding Lord Hien.
objectives: With the chat mode in Say, enter any phrase containing “Mol” to search for a Mol woman.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: Is it just me, or is everyone here Xaela?

dialogue.name: GOSETSU
dialogue.text: I must confess that this is my first time on the Steppe...

dialogue.name: YUGIRI
dialogue.text: When last I spoke with Lord Hien, he said he spent much time in these markets. I had hoped we might find him here today, but alas...

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: Hey, Yugiri, I've been meaning to ask─there are an awful lot of Xaela here, aren't there?

dialogue.name: YUGIRI
dialogue.text: Oh, I assumed you knew. The Azim Steppe has been home to the nomadic tribes of the Xaela since antiquity.

dialogue.name: YUGIRI
dialogue.text: More than fifty roam these lands, and though they do not constitute a nation, there is a hierarchy of sorts, determined through ritual combat.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: Funny... If they're so busy fighting each other, you'd think the Empire would be able to march in and take the Steppe with ease. I wonder why they haven't...

dialogue.name: GOSETSU
dialogue.text: Why indeed, Lyse? Why indeed...

dialogue.name: GOSETSU
dialogue.text: Perhaps they see little value in it, especially given the fierce reputation of the Xaela warriors who would fight tooth and nail to oppose them.

dialogue.name: YUGIRI
dialogue.text: These lands were not made for men. The soil is thin, and the weather unforgiving.

dialogue.name: YUGIRI
dialogue.text: The Xaela found ways to survive, it is true. But they are made of sterner stuff than most imperials─conscript or citizen.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: Thanks for taking the time to explain. It sounds like I've got a lot to learn. Later, I mean. We're meant to be looking for Hien!

dialogue.name: YUGIRI
dialogue.text: People from many tribes gather in Reunion to trade goods and information. I should be surprised if we cannot learn something of value here.

dialogue.name: YUGIRI
dialogue.text: Let us make our inquiries separately. Forename, why don't you speak with some of the merchants here?

dialogue.name: CHAMBUI
dialogue.text: Buuz! Fresh buuz! Your choice of lamb or dzo! Guaranteed to satisfy! How many will you have, misssir?

dialogue.name: CHAMBUI
dialogue.text: Eh? A Doman? Unless another Dazkar is keeping him in her yurt, he is not here. <snort> More fool her if she took a Doman for a husband.

dialogue.name: CHAMBUI
dialogue.text: But enough about Domans─let us speak of buuz instead! You cannot come to the Azim Steppe and not sample this most traditional of delicacies!

dialogue.name: CHAMBUI
dialogue.text: But enough about Domans─let us speak of buuz instead! Surely your mother or father made you some when you were little? A Xaela who never eats buuz is never a whole Xaela!

dialogue.name: CHAMBUI
dialogue.text: You there! Why don't you have a buuz in your hand right now?

dialogue.name: YESUI
dialogue.text: What fortune you have to come hither at this time! Freshly slaughtered, every cut available on request. Organs too─hearts, livers, brains. Or a brace of blood sausages, if you desire only a snack!

dialogue.name: YESUI
dialogue.text: A Doman? Poor meat they make, Domans─ I jest, I jest. Hmm...I did see a young Mol in the company of one some few days ago...

dialogue.name: YESUI
dialogue.text: Are you sure you do not wish to purchase anything? Organs as fresh as these will be gone before you know it!

dialogue.name: BAIDUR
dialogue.text: Roasted fish with pumpkin! An exotic foreign delicacy, cooked to perfection, beloved without the Steppe! Come, come!

dialogue.name: BAIDUR
dialogue.text: You seek Domans? Then you are come to the wrong place, my friend. Delicious as my foodstuffs are, they find little favor with those from the south.

dialogue.name: BAIDUR
dialogue.text: Now, if it were Goro you were looking for, on the other hand, then I might be able to help you. They flock to my stall!

dialogue.name: BAIDUR
dialogue.text: Doubtless you know well the wonders of Western cuisine. Then I need not persuade you to partake, yes? Come, come─eat your fill!

dialogue.name: CIRINA
dialogue.text: I did not think it would be so expensive...

dialogue.name: NARENGAWA
dialogue.text: There, there. You did well to travel so far.

dialogue.name: UCUGEN
dialogue.text: Where shall we go next?

dialogue.name: GORO02500
dialogue.text: I have brought you a new brush, my beloved. So smooth and silky your mane shall be─the envy of every other man...

dialogue.name: GORO02500
dialogue.text: Hm? Say again? You are seeking who?

dialogue.name: GORO02500
dialogue.text: Ah, the Doman. I know of whom you speak. He comes and goes with a Mol girl.

dialogue.name: GORO02500
dialogue.text: Though I could not describe her. I only know that she is Mol because I heard them talking as they passed.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: With the chat mode in Say, use your keyboard or the software keyboard to enter any phrase that contains “Mol” to ask the Xaela in Reunion if they are of the Mol tribe.

dialogue.name: GORO02500
dialogue.text: Oh, my dearest, how do I love thee? Let me count the ways...

dialogue.name: NARENGAWA
dialogue.text: I am Ura, if you must know. Come down from the mountains in the north. If there is nothing else...

dialogue.name: UCUGEN
dialogue.text: You take me for a Mol!? I am Oronir! Compare me not with ones so weak and lowly!

dialogue.name: CIRINA
dialogue.text: ...Yes? I am Mol. My name is Cirina. May I help you?

dialogue.name: CIRINA
dialogue.text: Oh... Oh, I see. You are looking for Hien. In that case─

dialogue.name: MASGUD
dialogue.text: How urgent this business must be to leave our conversation unfinished!

dialogue.name: MASGUD
dialogue.text: The kinsai. Will you buy it? There is but one bundle left. If not, then─

dialogue.name: CIRINA
dialogue.text: I will, I will! Though I had not thought to pay so high a price...

dialogue.name: MASGUD
dialogue.text: It is a bargain for which you should be grateful. If you lack the coin, then the fault is your own, and you will leave with nothing.

dialogue.name: CIRINA
dialogue.text: Please, I must have the kinsai! The gods themselves requested it! We are bound to their will!

dialogue.name: MASGUD
dialogue.text: ...Pay me the difference in whisperroot. I will sell it to the next apothecary to pass through Reunion, and we will each feel fairly treated.

dialogue.name: MASGUD
dialogue.text: But do not tarry. Should another come before you, coin in hand, I will not refuse him.

dialogue.name: CIRINA
dialogue.text: I understand. Thank you for this kindness!

dialogue.name: CIRINA
dialogue.text: I am sorry, but we must speak of Hien later. I cannot leave Reunion without that kinsai...

dialogue.name: SAYTODO
dialogue.text: Mol
